title: Punitive Reset
outcome: With BCI failures isolating neighborhoods, the Directorate seizes its chance to impose a 'Harmony Reset.' Power, transport, and BCI privileges are granted only to districts with high compliance scores, freezing out Halden Zones and protest hubs. Once-privileged neighborhoods now face sudden service loss, while displaced residents flood more lenient districts, straining resources. Public outrage grows as citizens realize the system’s fallback logic is disproportionately punitive. The Council faces internal revolt as Harmonists and Innovators push back against security-first policies.

events.description: Directorate implements 'Harmony Reset,' cutting power, transport, and BCI privileges from dissenting and low-score neighborhoods.
Long lines and makeshift camps appear as displaced citizens seek refuge in compliant districts. Resource shortages and tense standoffs erupt at district boundaries.
Reports reveal that even some high-score, loyalist neighborhoods face random service loss as BCI algorithms misfire, deepening public resentment.
Harmonists and Innovators openly challenge the Directorate's methods in Council sessions, threatening to pull support unless punitive resets are reversed.
